Class javachart.chart.Axis 
All Packages  Class Hierarchy  This Package  Previous  Next  Index

Class javachart.chart.Axis 

java.lang.Object
   |
   +----javachart.chart.Axis
public class Axis
extends Object
implements AxisInterface
The superclass for all JavaChart's standard axis classes, Axis implements methods for drawing grids, labels and ticks that can be easily re-used in Axis subclasses. In particular, Axis uses the method whereOnAxis() to determine where to draw labels, grids, and ticks, and uses the method getLabel() to get a specific axis label. This means that you can easily subclass and modify Axis behavior by changing getLabel and whereOnAxis. When used in concert with the class variables numLabels, numTicks and so on, these methods can even draw ticks, labels and grids at irregular intervals, such as those defined by the DateAxis subclass.
See Also:
Axis, LabelAxis, DateAxis, StackAxis, SpeedoAxis, HiLoAxis

Axis 
  public Axis(Dataset dsets[],
              boolean xAxis,
              Plotarea plt)
Constructs an Axis for the specified array of datasets
Parameters:
dsets - Array of Dataset classes to consider
xAxis - true if this is an X axis
plt - The Plotarea bounded by this Axis

  public synchronized void draw(Graphics g)
Draws this Axis, including grids, ticks and labels. This method is usually invoked automatically by the Chart class containing this Axis.
Parameters:
g - Graphic class to use for drawing

setSide 
  public void setSide(int num)
Assigns this axis to a particular side of the Plotarea. Sides are numbered as follows: bottom - 0, left - 1, top - 2, right - 3.
Parameters:
num - A new side
getBarScaling 
  public boolean getBarScaling()
Returns true if this axis is scaled for a bar/column chart. Axis for a bar/column chart always starts from zero, or the lowest value for negative number. Axis for charts other than bar/column starts from the lowest value of the chart.
Returns:
Bar/column chart scaling option
setBarScaling 
  public void setBarScaling(boolean yesNo)
Set scaling option to accomodate bar/column charts.
Parameters:
yesNo - whether to scale for bars
getUseDisplayList 
  public boolean getUseDisplayList()
Returns true if this Axis places values into the chart's DisplayList.
Returns:
Status of display list usage
See Also:
DisplayList
setUseDisplayList 
  public void setUseDisplayList(boolean onOff)
Determines whether this Axis should add values to the Chart's DisplayList. By default this is true.
Parameters:
onOff - New status of useDisplayList
See Also:
DisplayList
setLabelFormat 
  public void setLabelFormat(int i)
Determines what format to use for this Axis' labels. The default is Gc.DEFAULT_FORMAT, which is a machine-dependent representation for Java 1.0x, and may include Scientific notation. Other possibilities include Gc.COMMA_FORMAT, which formats numbers as 1,000.00 and Gc.EURO_FORMAT, which formats numbers like 1.000,00.
Parameters:
i - label format
getLabelFormat 
  public int getLabelFormat()
Returns this Axis' label format value.
Returns:
label format

whereOnAxis 
  protected int whereOnAxis(int whichStep,
                            int whichElement)
computes the location along an axis of a particular tick, grid, or label
Parameters:
whichStep - how many increments along Axis
whichElement - axisLabels, minTicks, majTicks, or gridLines
